items.title: how to handle foreign region timeout in Aliyun SDK
items.body:
* **Python Version**:
python 3.6
* **aliyunsdkcore Version**:
2.13.11
* **API**:
aliyun-python-sdk-ecs==4.19.9
aliyun-python-sdk-vpc==3.0.9

Hi,

I'm using Aliyun SDK for manipulating the aliyun resource, but I found that connection timeout frequently happen in API call especially when I operate resource in foreign regions like Frankfurt or Dubai. 

```
ERROR aliyunsdkcore.client [-] HttpError occurred. Host:vpc.eu-central-1.aliyuncs.com SDK-Version:2.13.25 ClientException:SDK.HttpError HTTPConnectionPool(host='vpc.eu-central-1.aliyuncs.com', port=80): Max retries exceeded with url: (Caused by ConnectTimeoutError(<aliyunsdkcore.vendored.requests.packages.urllib3.connection.HTTPConnection object at 0x7fd6477afa90>, 'Connection to vpc.eu-central-1.aliyuncs.com timed out. (connect timeout=5)'))
```

I checked `vpc.eu-central-1.aliyuncs.com` locate in Germany, but my location is in Shanghai, does it mean that it's common problem as long as I do the operation for this kind of region? But it didn't happen when I use Aliyun web page. 

Is there a way for user to send request to the single API endpoint via SDK? And aliyun web service is responsible to distribute these request to different region in internal network. Otherwise, it's hard to use SDK in domestic to operate foreign region.

best regards.

items.body:

* **Python Version**: Python 2.7.15
* **aliyunsdkcore Version**: 2.13.16
* **API**: DescribeNetworkInterfacesRequest

 <!-- Enter your issue details below this comment. -->

```
$ pip freeze | grep aliyun
aliyun-python-sdk-core==2.13.16
aliyun-python-sdk-ecs==4.19.4
```

We can't get correct response of DescribeNetworkInterfacesRequest in Python SDK. 
Inputs: `request.add_query_param('NetworkInterfaceIds', "['eni-2zecgyekouc3s4rpcsoq']")`
Outputs:
```
{'RegionId': 'cn-beijing', 'NetworkInterfaceId.1': '[', 'SignatureMethod': 'HMAC-SHA1', 'Version': '2014-05-26', 'NetworkInterfaceId.13': 'y', 'NetworkInterfaceId.18': 'c', 'NetworkInterfaceId.19': '3', 'PageSize': '500', 'Format': 'JSON', 'NetworkInterfaceId.14': 'e', 'NetworkInterfaceId.15': 'k', 'NetworkInterfaceId.16': 'o', 'NetworkInterfaceId.17': 'u', 'NetworkInterfaceId.10': 'e', 'NetworkInterfaceId.11': 'c', 'NetworkInterfaceId.12': 'g', 'SignatureType': '', 'NetworkInterfaceId.8': '2', 'NetworkInterfaceId.27': 'q', 'NetworkInterfaceId.6': 'i', 'NetworkInterfaceId.7': '-', 'NetworkInterfaceId.4': 'e', 'NetworkInterfaceId.5': 'n', 'NetworkInterfaceId.2': 'u', 'NetworkInterfaceId.3': '"', 'Signature': 'GTQh2EUXCr5r6MrmwI+T/Z/uaFo=', 'Action': 'DescribeNetworkInterfaces', 'SignatureNonce': '5bf2f592-c9ed-5342-837c-42a4c099c211', 'NetworkInterfaceName': 'cheshi-nic-ac6', 'NetworkInterfaceId.9': 'z', 'NetworkInterfaceId.25': 's', 'NetworkInterfaceId.24': 'c', 'SignatureVersion': '1.0', 'NetworkInterfaceId.26': 'o', 'NetworkInterfaceId.21': '4', 'NetworkInterfaceId.20': 's', 'NetworkInterfaceId.23': 'p', 'NetworkInterfaceId.22': 'r', 'NetworkInterfaceId.29': ']', 'NetworkInterfaceId.28': '"', 'Timestamp': '2020-08-12T01:43:09Z'}
```

It seems like a known issue related to https://github.com/aliyun/aliyun-openapi-python-sdk/issues/78, however it has been closed, so I have to open a new one against Python SDK.

Thanks,
Charles

items.title: UnicodeEncodeError raised with pytest cause of **sys.setdefaultencoding**
items.body:
<!--
Thank you for reporting an issue.
 This issue tracker is for bugs and issues found within Alibaba Cloud SDK for Python.
If you require more general support please file an issue on our help
repo. https://help.aliyun.com/
 Please fill in as much of the template below as you're able.
 Python Version: output of `python --version`
aliyunsdkcore Version: output of `aliyunsdkcore.__version__`
API: The API of the product, for example `DescribeRegionsRequest`
 If possible, please provide code that demonstrates the problem, keeping it as
simple and free of external dependencies as you are able.
-->

* **Python Version**:
Python 2.7.16

* **aliyunsdkcore Version**:
2.13.23

 <!-- Enter your issue details below this comment. -->


I found some breaking change was import from 2.13.22, as follows:
``` python
diff --git a/aliyun-python-sdk-core/aliyunsdkcore/client.py b/aliyun-python-sdk-core/aliyunsdkcore/client.py
index 74567639..bd59f227 100644
--- a/aliyun-python-sdk-core/aliyunsdkcore/client.py
+++ b/aliyun-python-sdk-core/aliyunsdkcore/client.py
@@ -25,6 +25,7 @@ import logging
 import jmespath
 import copy
 import platform
+import sys

 import aliyunsdkcore
 from aliyunsdkcore.vendored.six.moves.urllib.parse import urlencode
@@ -55,6 +56,10 @@ from aliyunsdkcore.vendored.requests.structures import OrderedDict
 Acs default client module.
 """

+if sys.version_info.major == 2:
+    reload(sys)
+    sys.setdefaultencoding('utf-8')
+
 DEFAULT_READ_TIMEOUT = 10
 DEFAULT_CONNECTION_TIMEOUT = 5
```

This change may cause an effect with pytest, here has a base function in pytest/compat.py:
``` python
    def _escape_strings(val):
        """In py2 bytes and str are the same type, so return if it's a bytes
        object, return it unchanged if it is a full ascii string,
        otherwise escape it into its binary form.

        If it's a unicode string, change the unicode characters into
        unicode escapes.

        """
        if isinstance(val, bytes):
            try:
                return val.encode('ascii')
            except UnicodeEncodeError:
                return val.encode('string-escape')
        else:
            return val.encode('unicode-escape')
```

As the code above, if the value's type was a string, pytest try encode the value with **ASCII** encoding which was the default in python. but aliyun-openapi-python-sdk changes the default encoding to **UTF-8**, which will cause decode success and encode failed. so An UnicodeEncodeError will raise. 

First, as a base module, aliyun sdk should not import some breaking changes to users. And, I do not think **sys.setdefaultencoding** takes no effects, actually, the use of sys.setdefaultencoding() has always been discouraged.

items.title: Python3.8使用aliyunsdkalidns出错
File conflict between aliyun-python-sdk-dysmsapi and aliyun-python-sdk-dybaseapi
items.body:
I'm currently packaging the Python Alibaba SDK for openSUSE/SLE and I have run into some issues, in this case with the packages ```aliyun-python-sdk-dysmsapi``` and ```aliyun-python-sdk-dybaseapi```.

Both packages are trying to install the file ```/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/aliyunsdkdybaseapi/__init__.py``` (see RPM output below):

```
File /usr/lib/$PYTHONVER/site-packages/aliyunsdkdybaseapi/__init__.py
  from install of
     python3-aliyun-python-sdk-dysmsapi-1.0.0-2.1.noarch (Branch project for package python-aliyun-python-sdk-aas (openSUSE_Tumbleweed))
  conflicts with file from install of
     python3-aliyun-python-sdk-dybaseapi-1.0.4-2.1.noarch (Branch project for package python-aliyun-python-sdk-aas (openSUSE_Tumbleweed))
```

This prevents the co-installation of both packages.

If both packages are supposed to use same directory, I recommend using the namespace feature (implicit namespaces for Python 3), similar to what Microsoft is using for it's Python Azure SDK (see: https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-python).


If I understand correctly, the package ```aliyun-python-sdk-core-v3``` is required for Python 3. However, some packages of the SDK have a strict dependency on ```aliyun-python-sdk-core```, while others depend on ```aliyun-python-sdk-core-v3``` in their ```setup.py```.

For example, ```aliyun-python-sdk-aas``` depends on ```aliyun-python-sdk-core``` while ```python-aliyun-python-sdk-arms4finance``` depends on ```aliyun-python-sdk-core-v3```.

As a result,  ```aliyun-python-sdk-aas``` and ```python-aliyun-python-sdk-arms4finance``` cannot be installed at the same time.

A similar file conflict exists between ```aliyun-python-sdk-dysmsapi``` and ```aliyun-python-sdk-dybaseapi``` for which I will file a separate bug report.

items.title: Time format not accepted by API
items.body:
The SDK throws the below error between 12.00-01.00 GMT when requests have a date header in the format of `Wed, 12 Feb 2020 01:41:59 AM GMT`, and there is nothing in the SDK to stop this format as `%X` (locale) is used to get the time -- a locale of `t_fmt="%r"` for `LC_TIME` results in the problematic time format.

```
aliyunsdkcore.acs_exception.exceptions.ServerException: HTTP Status: 400 Error:InvalidTimeStamp.Expired Specified time stamp or date value is expired. RequestID: 
```

Please either make this format work with the API endpoint or alternatively, take a look at my PR to fix the date format used by the SDK -- https://github.com/aliyun/aliyun-openapi-python-sdk/pull/312

items.title: TLS Certifiate Verfication disabled
items.body:
The verification of TLS certificates is disabled in the code. This means that a MITM attack will go undetected. From the source: https://github.com/aliyun/aliyun-openapi-python-sdk/blob/5a6317a5f39840b9ebc247fbff39c30d4f81521a/aliyun-python-sdk-core/aliyunsdkcore/http/http_response.py#L122

```python
            proxies = {
                "http": proxy_http,
                "https": proxy_https,
            }
            # ignore the warning-InsecureRequestWarning
            urllib3.disable_warnings()

            response = s.send(prepped, proxies=proxies,
                              timeout=(self.__connect_timeout, self.__read_timeout),
                              allow_redirects=False, verify=None, cert=None)
```

items.title: aliyunsdkcore/auth/signers/ecs_ram_role_signer TypeError
items.body:
https://github.com/aliyun/aliyun-openapi-python-sdk/blob/f0b2a41e01ea09e552a23720bf0f757bfcb37291/aliyun-python-sdk-core/aliyunsdkcore/auth/signers/ecs_ram_role_signer.py#L54

**Summary**
Python script used for pushing custom metric to Cloud Monitor which is executed from an ECS instance within a scaling group. The python script uses the EcsRamRoleSigner for authentication

**The Error**
The Signer automatically calls the def _check_session_credential(self) on subsequent API calls, but this function fails with the following error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "c:\push_metric\push_custom_metric.py", line 166, in <module>
    main(args)
  File "c:\push_metric\push_custom_metric.py", line 136, in main
    targets = get_active_instances(client, ess_id)
  File "c:\push_metric\push_custom_metric.py", line 98, in get_active_instances
    response = client.do_action_with_exception(ess_request)
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\aliyunsdkcore\client.py", line 258, in do_action_with_exception
    status, headers, body = self.implementation_of_do_action(acs_request)
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\aliyunsdkcore\client.py", line 224, in implementation_of_do_action
    http_response = self._make_http_response(endpoint, request, signer)
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\aliyunsdkcore\client.py", line 183, in _make_http_response
    header, url = signer.sign(self.__region_id, request)
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\aliyunsdkcore\auth\signers\ecs_ram_role_singer.py", line 39, in sign
    self._check_session_credential()
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\aliyunsdkcore\auth\signers\ecs_ram_role_singer.py", line 52, in _check_session_cre
dential
    if now - self._last_update_time > (self._expiration * self._REFRESH_SCALE):
**TypeError: can't multiply sequence by non-int of type 'float'**

**Reason**
self._expiration is not an int, it is a datetime unicode string with the following format: `2019-01-14T13:45:02Z` 

**Temporary workaround**
Changing line 54 to `if now >= (time.mktime(exp_date):`

items.title: client.py的_parse_error_info_from_response_body解析JSON的问题
items.body:
client.py的第244行，传递进来的response_body在python3上是byte类型，但是没有进行解码，在python版本上，json库可以直接loads byte类型的数据；但是在python3.5.2版本上json库不能loads byte类型的数据，导致报TypeError异常，但是没有捕捉，导致报错；
建议在处理response_boyd时都进行decode处理，以便兼容

items.title: aliyunsdkcore python 2.7.15: Error:ContentMD5NotMatched
items.body:
Hello,

I am trying to use aliyun-openapi-python-sdk-ros, using examples from https://github.com/nxintech/Charlie/tree/master/aliyun

Using Python 3.6, I can receive error messages from the API:
```
File "/Users/robert.stmarie/.pyenv/versions/3.6.0/lib/python3.6/site-packages/aliyunsdkcore/client.py", line 277, in do_action_with_exception
    request_id=request_id)
aliyunsdkcore.acs_exception.exceptions.ServerException: HTTP Status: 400 Error:StackValidationFailed Property error: : Resources.tomcat7.Properties.InstanceChargeType: : "Prepaid" is not an allowed value [PrePaid, PostPaid] RequestID: None
```

However, using Python 2.7.15, I get MD5 mismatch errors:
```
File "/Users/robert.stmarie/.pyenv/versions/2.7.15/lib/python2.7/site-packages/aliyunsdkcore/client.py", line 277, in do_action_with_exception
    request_id=request_id)
aliyunsdkcore.acs_exception.exceptions.ServerException: HTTP Status: 400 Error:ContentMD5NotMatched Specified content md5 is not matched with your request body.
```

Here is `req.get_headers()` from each type:
```
python 3.6.0
>>> req.get_headers()
{[...] 'Content-MD5': '6jYzIMV1mAu5ff4JXX8jWA==', 'Date': 'Wed, 10 Oct 2018 18:22:47 GMT', [...]}

python 2.7.15
>> req.get_headers()
{[...]'Content-MD5': 'C3mnQVhc5m3Ry9XvMVptIQ==', 'Date': 'Wed, 10 Oct 2018 18:22:00 GMT', [...]}
```

I believe this is because of `auth/utils/md5_tool.py` differing in sdk-core and sdk-core-v3.  `core-v3` appears to convert `request.get_content()` into a byte array before encoding as base64:
```
def _get_md5(content):
    m = hashlib.md5()
    m.update(bytearray(content, "utf-8"))
    return m.digest()


def get_md5_base64_str(content):
    return str(base64.encodebytes(_get_md5(content)).strip(), "utf-8")
```

However, `core` does not do this:
```
def _get_md5(content):
    m = hashlib.md5()
    m.update(buffer(content))
    return m.digest()


def get_md5_base64_str(content):
    return base64.encodestring(_get_md5(content)).strip()
```

Swapping `core` implementation to the following resolves my issue and I can use the ROS SDK from Python 2.7.15:
```
def _get_md5(content):
    m = hashlib.md5()
    m.update(bytearray(content, "utf-8"))
    return m.digest()


def get_md5_base64_str(content):
    return str(base64.b64encode(_get_md5(content)))
```

items.title: aliyun-python-sdk-core/aliyunsdkcore/http/http_response.py 使用 httplib 导致线程不安全
items.body:
httplib 线程不安全, 详见 https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5825151/are-urllib2-and-httplib-thread-safe

复现方法:

1. 使用 concurrent.futures.ThreadPoolExecutor, 使用同一个 acs_client, 调用 do_action_with_exception
2. 在 aliyun-python-sdk-core/aliyunsdkcore/http/http_response.py:105 打日志, 输出 id(response)

会发现存在碰撞的情况

items.title: Pypi上aliyun-python-sdk-core-v3的代码和Github代码不一致
items.body:
目前Pypi上的aliyun-python-sdk-core-v3最新版本是2.8.9，使用时会出现错误：
```
aliyunsdkcore.acs_exception.exceptions.ClientException: SDK.InvalidRegionId Can not find endpoint to access.
```
调查后发现aliyun-python-sdk-core-v3中 client.py 文件中`_resolve_endpoint`和Github上的内容不一样：

Pypi上的版本：
```
    def _resolve_endpoint(self, request):
        return endpoint_resolver.resolve_endpoint(self.__region_id, request, self._location_service)
```

Github上版本：
```
    def _resolve_endpoint(self, request):

        if isinstance(request, CommonRequest) and request.get_domain():
            return request.get_domain()

        endpoint = None
        if request.get_location_service_code() is not None:
            endpoint = self._location_service.find_product_domain(
                self.get_region_id(), request.get_location_service_code(), request.get_product(),
                request.get_location_endpoint_type())
        if endpoint is None:
            endpoint = region_provider.find_product_domain(
                self.get_region_id(), request.get_product())
            if endpoint is None:
                raise ClientException(
                    error_code.SDK_INVALID_REGION_ID,
                    error_msg.get_msg('SDK_INVALID_REGION_ID'))
            if not isinstance(request, AcsRequest):
                raise ClientException(
                    error_code.SDK_INVALID_REQUEST,
                    error_msg.get_msg('SDK_INVALID_REQUEST'))
        return endpoint
```

应该是没有更新Pypi上的代码，希望可以尽快解决。
